item.description:
Update  

We are seeing the 7:10 show, which is 3d, because the Boston Common is not showing a non-3d version. I will be at the theater at 6:10, I will be wearing my red hat with the meetup logo. We'll go in and get seats at 6:45.  If the movie is upstairs, I'll be waiting by the tables by the big window in the second floor lobby, and if it's downstairs I'll be behind the ropes across from the refreshment stand.

If you miss the group before the movie, no worries, you can meet us after. We gather outside the doors of the room showing the movie afterwards. Then we head out for some munchies and drinkies.

I have found my red meetup hat! It is red, and white, and has an obnoxious meetup logo on it, so I should be easy to spot if you look in the right place! Note that to get to the upstairs lobby, you have to buy a ticket.

I strongly encourage folks to buy tickets ahead of time at fandango.com.

 

Synopsis

"Priest," a western-fused post-apocalyptic thriller, is set in an alternate world -- one ravaged by centuries of war between man and vampires. The story revolves around a legendary Warrior Priest (Paul Bettany) from the last Vampire War who now lives in obscurity among the other downtrodden human inhabitants in walled-in dystopian cities ruled by the Church. When his niece (Lily Collins) is abducted by a murderous pack of vampires, Priest breaks his sacred vows to venture out on an obsessive quest to find her before they turn her into one of them. He is joined on his crusade by his niece's boyfriend (Cam Gigandet), a trigger-fingered young wasteland sheriff, and a former Warrior Priestess (Maggie Q) who possesses otherworldly fighting skills. 

 

 

Trailers 'n' Stuff

http://www.comingsoon.net/films.php?id=15696
item.how_to_find_us: Please see the description for how to find the group.
item.why: Warrior priests are wicked cool, especially post-apocolypse! And this church, unlike another that will not be mentioned, has no issue with female priests.
item.name: Priest
